result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy L. Lo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with each other and concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.

No possession of controlled substance unless possessed with advanced written approval of agent and with lawful prescription.  
Absolute sobriety.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the department.
Court finds defendant eligible for SAP and CIP.
AMENDED: 2 years extended supervision

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with each other and concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Amy L. Lo
Current: 717 Jackson St, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 08-04-2017)
Prior: 120-1/2 North 1st Avenue, Wausau, WI 54401
regarding sentence adjustment
from DOC to Judge Jacobson re: review/change of JOC (sent to judge)
Plea & Sentencing
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:01 am 
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence for Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Erik Mcfarland.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Possession of Controlled Substance/PTAC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/PTAC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct. 3 (Neglecting a Child/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Mcfarland makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1>>4.5 years imprisonment - 1.5 years IC and 3 years ES - to run concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentence def is currently serving
                           : On Ct. 3>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES - to run concurrent to each other and any other sentence def is currently serving. 
COURT ORDERS payment of court costs. 
COURT ORDERS as conditions of ES>>Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; no possession of controlled substance unless possessed with advanced written approval of agent and with lawful prescription; absolute sobriety.
COURT finds the def is entitled to 153 days sentence credit. 
COURT find the def eligible for SAP and CIP. 
COURT remands def to the sheriff's dept for transport. 

Adj: 9:19 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
for Release of CPS Report
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Final pre-trial on January 5, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on November 7, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's
Pre-trial conference on October 15, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

AMENDED Absolute sobriety.   Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 for Day report.  No contact with co-defendant(s): C.P., B.Q., & T.E. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. *Allowed contact with B.Q. while both in custody as long as they don't discuss case and if released no contact will be fully in place,*
Probable Cause Found
of Preliminary Examination

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 8:24 am 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Erik Mcfarland. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed. Reading Waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to set future dates. 
Atty Mcfarland requests no contact with B.Q. be amended to no discussing of the case with B.Q. State does not object. 
COURT modifies bond to allow contact with B.Q. while both in custody as long as they do not discuss case and if released, no contact will be fully in place. 
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 8:27 am
Preliminary Hearing on October 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Erik McFarland
Pre-trial conference on September 9, 2014 at 09:10 am.
